title: OSD: stop recording while Hovering never enters lingering
description: The state machine does not handle PhaseChanged{idle} while in Hovering state. This violates the invariant that visual state should enter Lingering when domain becomes idle. Currently (Hovering, PhaseChanged{idle}) is a no-op, leaving pulse animation running and OSD visible indefinitely. Need to add transition: (Hovering, PhaseChanged{idle}) -> (Lingering, [StartLingerTimer, StopPulseAnimation]).

title: Add CUDA GPU acceleration support to Dictate
description: Implement GPU acceleration using CUDA provider in sherpa-rs. Current state: sherpa-rs only supports CUDA (not Vulkan/ROCm like voxtype's whisper-rs). Plan: 1) Add gpu-cuda feature flag to Cargo.toml, 2) Add GpuProvider enum to config (CPU/CUDA), 3) Update model loading to pass provider parameter, 4) Add CUDA runtime detection, 5) Add GPU settings to Svelte frontend, 6) Implement fallback behavior when CUDA unavailable. Target: 2-5x transcription speed improvement for NVIDIA users while maintaining CPU fallback for compatibility. Originally created as dictate-jgp, recreated after git-history-backfill pruned it.

title: Phase 4: System Integration & CLI Interface
description: Add comprehensive CLI interface following voxtype patterns with subcommands (daemon, transcribe, config, setup, status, history). Implement file-based history management to replace SQLx. Add systemd service integration and Linux desktop setup utilities.

title: OSD Architecture Overhaul
description: Comprehensive overhaul of OSD architecture based on oracle review. Includes: bug fixes, state machine hardening, backend abstraction, and cross-platform expansion. Key insight: keep patterns (state machine, timeline, theme), fix layering (domain vs presentation), build backend trait, don't jump to separate process until simpler approaches fail.

title: Add CUDA GPU acceleration support to Dictate
design: Implement GPU acceleration using CUDA provider in sherpa-rs. Current state: sherpa-rs only supports CUDA (not Vulkan/ROCm like voxtype's whisper-rs). Plan: 1) Add gpu-cuda feature flag to Cargo.toml, 2) Add GpuProvider enum to config (CPU/CUDA), 3) Update model loading to pass provider parameter, 4) Add CUDA runtime detection, 5) Add GPU settings to Svelte frontend, 6) Implement fallback behavior when CUDA unavailable. Target: 2-5x transcription speed improvement for NVIDIA users while maintaining CPU fallback for compatibility.
acceptance_criteria:
CPU build works without CUDA dependencies
CUDA feature flag compiles with NVIDIA support
GPU provider selectable in settings UI
CUDA runtime detection and user guidance
Model loading uses provider parameter correctly
Graceful fallback to CPU when CUDA unavailable
Performance benchmark shows speed improvement
Separate build variants (CPU vs CUDA) working

title: Preserve and adapt config.rs for daemon
description: Keep existing config.rs structure and TOML format. Remove Tauri-specific SettingsState and RwLock dependencies. Add direct load/save methods for use in daemon. Ensure model preferences, audio settings, OSD configuration remain compatible. Test configuration file loading and error handling.

title: Phase 4d: Daemon State Synchronization
description: Integrate status manager with daemon event loop as part of Phase 4 System Integration. Hook into existing daemon state transitions from Phase 2 (dictate-crq). Update state file on every state change with minimal overhead. Map daemon states (Idle, Recording, Transcribing, Error) to status states. Handle daemon startup/shutdown cleanup and ensure atomic state updates. Test state synchronization across all daemon flows including error scenarios. Depends on Phase 4c CLI Status Command completion.

title: Extract OSD module to new location
description: Move src-tauri/src/osd/ to src/osd/ preserving all functionality. Update imports and paths for OSD components. Ensure iced + iced_layershell dependencies are preserved. Test OSD compilation and visual appearance in new location. Keep all widgets, animations, and state machine intact.

title: Create OsdBackend trait for window management abstraction
description: Abstract window management behind a trait: trait OsdBackend { fn ensure_window(&mut self); fn set_visible(&mut self, visible: bool); fn set_geometry(...); fn destroy_window(&mut self); }. Start with LayerShellBackend implementing this. See spec: https://gist.github.com/joshuadavidthomas/c4a94f6a4e62111b9a26636f52fdbf38 (05-backend-trait.md). The prototype branch 'claude/implement-relm4-prototypes-01GTSH9fzrzhp9J1CTVjqCff' can be referenced for iced_layershell usage patterns in app.rs, but the backend abstraction is new.
notes:
CONTEXT: Foundation work complete (dictate-ali). timeline.rs and theme.rs ready. Backend trait will be implemented AFTER state machine rewrite (dictate-6t2) completes.

SCOPE:
1. Create backend.rs with OsdBackend trait per spec (05-backend-trait.md)
2. Implement LayerShellBackend (current iced_layershell code)
3. Update app.rs to use backend trait (decouple from iced_layershell directly)

REFERENCE: Spec gist 05-backend-trait.md. Prototype app.rs has iced_layershell usage patterns to extract.

title: Create hotkey coordination module
description: Create hotkey.rs as main coordination for hotkey systems. Implement HotkeyManager with evdev primary detection and Wayland Portal fallback. Add hotkey parsing from existing shortcut strings to evdev key codes. Create hotkey event enum (Pressed/Released) and channel communication to daemon. Handle permission errors gracefully.

title: Document idle_hot bug pattern to avoid
description: In the prototype, StateChanged events passed idle_hot but match arms used the OLD value. This is a class of bug caused by duplicating domain data in every visual state variant. Document this as anti-pattern in the spec. The fix is structural: store domain data once and reference it. Don't duplicate RecordingSnapshot/idle_hot in every OsdVisualState variant.

title: Update build configuration and deployment
description: Update Cargo.toml release profile for optimization (lto, codegen-units, strip). Add feature flags for GPU acceleration (gpu-vulkan, gpu-cuda, gpu-metal). Update build.rs if needed. Create systemd service file and desktop entry. Test build performance and binary size.

title: Implement file-based history management
description: Create output/history.rs to replace SQLx database. Implement HistoryManager with save_transcription() to timestamped text files, list_transcriptions() with chronological sorting, and search_transcriptions() with text matching. Use ~/.local/share/dictate/history/ directory. Create simple JSON index for fast search capabilities.

title: Extract and adapt audio capture system
description: Move src-tauri/src/recording.rs to src/audio/ preserving CPAL capture and FFT spectrum analysis. Create audio.rs coordination module. Remove Tauri shortcut handling, integrate with hotkey system. Ensure spectrum data flows to OSD via broadcast channels. Test device management and audio quality.

title: Fix or remove unused transcription_result field
description: In prototype app.rs, transcription_result is set (lines 209, 218) but never read in render logic. May or may not apply depending on what code is ported from prototype branch 'claude/implement-relm4-prototypes-01GTSH9fzrzhp9J1CTVjqCff' to fresh implementation. Review when implementing fresh branch - either use it to display transcription results or remove it.

title: Extract and adapt transcription engines
description: Move src-tauri/src/transcription/ to src/transcription/ preserving sherpa-rs integrations. Remove Tauri-specific progress reporting, replace with broadcast messages. Keep model catalog, download system, and engine switching. Test Whisper, Moonshine, and Parakeet TDT engine loading and functionality.

title: Phase 4: Bar Integration Generation
description: Create ready-to-use configurations for popular status bars. Support Waybar (primary), Polybar, i3status, Conky. Implement setup commands: 'dictate setup waybar', 'dictate setup status'. Generate JSON config snippets with proper click actions. Provide CSS templates with dictate-specific styling and animations. Include comprehensive documentation for each bar type.

title: Implement daemon.rs with tokio::select! event loop
description: Create daemon.rs with voxtype-inspired event loop. Implement DaemonState enum (Idle, Recording, Transcribing, Error). Use tokio::select! for hotkey events, timeout checks, and shutdown signals. Orchestrate interaction between hotkey, audio, transcription, and output components. Handle graceful shutdown.
notes:
Implementation guide:
- Follow voxtype daemon.rs pattern (438 lines reference in voxtype/src/daemon.rs)
- Use stub hotkey channel (tokio::sync::mpsc) for Phase 2
- Headless: no OSD integration yet (comes in Phase 5)
- State file management for Waybar integration
- tokio::select! event loop coordinating: hotkey → audio → transcription → output
- Handle recording timeout, graceful shutdown (Ctrl+C)
- State transitions: Idle → Recording → Transcribing → Idle

title: Linux X11 support
description: Enable OSD on Linux X11 sessions. Depends on WinitBackend. May need X11-specific hints via x11rb: _NET_WM_STATE_ABOVE, _NET_WM_STATE_STICKY, _NET_WM_STATE_SKIP_TASKBAR, _NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_NOTIFICATION. Test on: bare X11, XWayland on various compositors.

title: Research non-CUDA GPU options for sherpa-rs
description: Investigate future GPU acceleration options beyond CUDA for sherpa-rs. Current gap: voxtype supports Vulkan/ROCm/Metal via whisper-rs, but sherpa-rs only supports CUDA. Research: 1) Monitor sherpa-rs issues/discussions for OpenVINO, Vulkan, ROCm support, 2) Test ONNX Runtime provider support directly in Rust, 3) Evaluate feasibility of custom provider implementation, 4) Document timeline for broader GPU support in sherpa-rs ecosystem. Originally created as dictate-3va, recreated after git-history-backfill pruned it.

title: Generation-tag internal events to prevent stale completions
description: Add generation counter to animations and include it in completion events. Timeline should be authoritative source of completion. Ignore completion events with wrong generation. See spec: https://gist.github.com/joshuadavidthomas/c4a94f6a4e62111b9a26636f52fdbf38 (02-timeline-animation.md, 04-state-machine.md). The prototype branch timeline.rs is missing generation tags - extend it per spec.
notes:
CONTEXT: Generation tags ALREADY IMPLEMENTED in timeline.rs during foundation work (dictate-ali).

COMPLETED:
- Added generation counter to Timeline
- generation() method returns current animation generation
- is_generation_complete() checks if specific generation done
- Tests pass (test_generation_increments, test_old_generation_is_complete, etc.)

REMAINING WORK: Update state machine (dictate-6t2) and app.rs to USE generation tags when checking animation completion events. Pattern: store generation when starting animation, check generation when handling completion.

title: Transformation Epic: Voxtype-inspired Dictate Refactoring
description: Updated transformation epic to include comprehensive GPU acceleration research and implementation plan for Linux-only deployment. Research revealed sherpa-rs currently only supports CUDA, not the broader GPU providers (Vulkan, ROCm, etc.) available in voxtype's whisper-rs. Plan focuses on CUDA implementation first with extensible architecture for future GPU providers as sherpa-rs evolves.

title: Phase 4c: CLI Status Command with Follow Mode
description: Implement rich 'dictate status' command with real-time monitoring as part of Phase 4 System Integration. Support both text and JSON output formats for bar integration. Add --follow flag using notify crate for file watching. Include JSON format with icon, tooltip, CSS class for Waybar compatibility. Handle daemon not running gracefully and provide integration help in --help output. Commands: dictate status, dictate status --follow, dictate status --format json. Depends on Phase 4a Core State Management completion.

title: Document current GNOME/platform knowledge
description: Before punting GNOME decision, document what we know now: 1) Layer-shell doesn't work on GNOME, 2) XWayland relaunch approach and its risks (Flatpak, systemd, etc.), 3) What the cross-platform guide proposes, 4) Oracle's concerns. Put in docs/plans/ so knowledge isn't lost. This is a capture task, not a decision task.

title: Clean up dead code in animation.rs
description: In prototype animation.rs, only pulsing_waveform is still used. The rest (PulseTween, WindowTween, WidthTween, compute_window_animation, etc.) is dead code since timeline.rs was introduced. May or may not apply depending on what code is ported from prototype branch 'claude/implement-relm4-prototypes-01GTSH9fzrzhp9J1CTVjqCff' to fresh implementation. Review when implementing fresh branch - either move pulsing_waveform elsewhere or delete the dead code.

title: Implement WinitBackend for cross-platform support
description: Implement OsdBackend trait for iced+winit (non-layer-shell). This enables: Linux X11, Windows, macOS. Key considerations: 1) Always-on-top window level, 2) Decorations off, 3) Transparent background, 4) Click-through/input passthrough, 5) Positioning (screen geometry queries). This is the foundation for all non-Wayland-layer-shell platforms.
notes: Reopening: winit backend work is incomplete/broken; deferring cross-platform support to dictate-gtx epic.
